ca.uqac.lif.fs

Class PersistentFileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.fs.RamDisk
      • ca.uqac.lif.fs.PersistentFileSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileSystem

    public abstract class PersistentFileSystem
extends RamDisk
    A file system whose content is preserved within a single file of another file system. When open, the persistent file system reads that file, and uses method load(InputStream) to populate the contents of an internal ramdisk. All read/write operations are then performed directly on this in-memory structure. When closed, the persistent file system opens the same file as in the beginning, and uses the save(OutputStream) method to write the contents of its internal ramdisk back to this file.

    Exactly how the ramdisk contents is read and written is left to specific descendants of PersistentFileSystem, which must implement the load(InputStream) and save(OutputStream) methods and typically should leave all other methods as they are. A possible use case could be to read an archive file, manipulate its contents in memory, and write its contents back to a new version of the archive.

    Author:
    Sylvain Hallé

    • Method Detail

      • load

        protected abstract void load(java.io.InputStream is)
        Populates the ramdisk by reading the contents of an input file. The method is not expected to close the stream.
        Parameters:
        is - An input stream open on the contents of the file

      • save

        protected abstract void save(java.io.OutputStream os)
        Saves the contents of the ramdisk by writing it to a file. The method is not expected to close the stream.
        Parameters:
        os - An output stream open on the file to write to

      • open

        public void open()
          throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Starts the interaction with the file system. All operations invoked on a file system will throw a FileSystemException if called before this method.
        Specified by:
        open in interface FileSystem
        Overrides:
        open in class RamDisk
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the interaction with the file system cannot be started

      • close

        public void close()
           throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Stops the interaction with the file system. All operations invoked on a file system will throw a FileSystemException if called after this method.
        Specified by:
        close in interface FileSystem
        Overrides:
        close in class RamDisk
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if an error occurred while stopping the interaction with the file system
